rubber_type: Science Friction 3.0 (sole) / Xtreme Friction (toe patch) / Science Friction R2 (heel rand)
description: Sharp aggressive downturn targets steep boulder problems and overhanging routes with precision power. Science Friction 3.0 with velcro closure and soft feel creates reliable grip and responsive feedback. High-volume design offers all-day comfort without sacrificing the performance you need on hard pitches.
pros: Soft rubber maximizes grip and sensitivity
cons: Extra volume reduces edging precision feel
Limited midsole reduces foot arch support
Minimal ankle protection on rocky terrain
Cannot be resoled when worn through
sizing: Size up half a size as synthetic uppers will stretch with climbing. Best for wide feet and those seeking roomy, all-day comfort.
customer_voices: The downturn really shines on overhanging problems. After a few sessions, I realized these are exactly what I'd been looking for.
Incredible foot sensitivity on tiny features. When I need to trust my placements, I reach for these.
Coming from cramped shoes, the roomy fit lets me climb longer routes without discomfort.

description: Balanced profile suits climbers who prioritize comfort without sacrificing performance. Science Friction 3.0 with lace closure and stiff feel creates reliable grip and responsive feedback. Versatile fit works across different climbing styles and foot shapes.
cons: Limited midsole reduces foot arch support

sizing: Size up half a size as synthetic uppers will stretch with climbing.
customer_voices: The precision and support are unmatched at this level. These shoes keep up with my ambitions.
These work equally well in the gym and outdoors. Solid everyday climbing shoe that delivers performance.

description: Built for climbers who demand maximum power from pocket pulls and roofs, the Drago combines aggressive downturned geometry with a soft, sensitive sole that reads texture instantly. Its strong asymmetry and narrow Egyptian toe concentrate force through the big toe for uncompromising edge control. Designed for elite boulderers and sport climbers on overhanging terrain.
sizing: Runs true to size; microfiber upper has minimal stretch. Size to a snug fit from day one.
customer_voices: I use these exclusively for bouldering indoorsthe downturn and edge sensitivity are unreal for small holds and powerful sequences.
As an intermediate climber moving into sport climbing, the Drago feels aggressive to me, but my feet are narrower and they fit like a glove.

description: The low-volume variant of Scarpa's most aggressive performer, the Drago LV strips down the shoe for climbers with narrower, lower-volume feet. Identical downturn and asymmetry to its sibling, but in a sleeker package that improves heel lock and reduces weight. Perfect for elite athletes chasing ounces on rock and plastic.
sizing: Suits lower-volume and narrower feet. Size to a snug fit; minimal stretch expected. Consider LV if you find standard Drago loose in the heel.
customer_voices: I have narrow feet and finally found a shoe that doesn't slipthe LV is my go-to for overhanging problems.
Advanced boulderer here. The Drago LV is sharper than the standard Drago, which I prefer for technical climbing on small pockets.

description: Ultra-lightweight aggressive performer with zero midsole, the Furia Air is a minimalist's dream for sport climbing and bouldering. At just 300g, it delivers the sensitivity of a slipper with the precision of a lace shoe, using Vibram's softest grip rubber for texture feedback. The mid-depth toe patch balances durability with minimal bulk.
sizing: Low-volume and narrow fit; no stretch. Size to snug fit from day one. Recommended for narrow to medium-narrow feet.
customer_voices: Lightweight, responsive, and I can feel every bump on the wallperfect for my climbing style on overhanging routes.
The Furia Air is my second shoe for routes where I know every edge. The fit took some getting used to because of the low volume.

description: The standard-volume sibling in the Furia line, offering aggressive downturn and asymmetry in a slightly roomier fit than the Air variant. Soft rubber sole maintains the responsive feel while the medium heel and standard volume accommodate a wider range of foot shapes. Ideal for advanced climbers who need aggressive geometry without ultra-narrow constraints.
sizing: Standard volume with narrow width. Microfiber has minimal stretch. Size to a snug fit; expect no break-in period.
customer_voices: I boulder hard and the Furia S gives me the aggressive downturn I crave without feeling claustrophobic like the Air.
Advanced sport climber. The soft rubber is amazing for reading texture on limestone, and the fit is predictable right out of the box.

description: A workhorse for intermediate climbers, the VS blends moderate downturn with versatility across wall angles. Vibram XS Edge rubber provides edge bite without sacrificing smearing ability, while the partial midsole adds stability for longer pitches. Wide-fit last accommodates broader feet than typical Egyptian-focused designs.
sizing: Runs true to size with minimal stretch. The wide-fit last suits normal to broader feet. Snug but not restrictive from day one.
customer_voices: These are my everyday climbing shoeversatile enough for indoor walls and solid enough for outdoor granite routes.
The partial midsole and durable rubber mean I can wear these for full sessions without worry, and the edge control is solid.

description: The women's-specific version of the popular VS, engineered with lower volume and narrower heel fit while retaining the same moderate downturned performance and durable XS Edge rubber. Sized for female feet without sacrificing the versatility that makes the VS a beginner-to-advanced workhorse.
sizing: Women's-specific fit with low volume and narrow heel. Minimal stretch expected. Size to a snug, supportive fit.
customer_voices: Finally, a shoe engineered for my foot shapethe heel doesn't slip and the volume is perfect for women with narrower feet.
I use VS for training and projects. The durable rubber means multiple sessions a week without premature wear.

description: The softer sibling to the VS, the VSR swaps stiff rubber for supple Vibram XS Grip 2, maintaining the same wide-fit philosophy but with improved sensitivity on texture. A full-sole Grip 2 construction delivers feedback across the entire foot, making it ideal for varied climbing styles from slab to pocket.
sizing: Standard volume with medium width; minimal stretch. Wide-fit last accommodates diverse foot shapes. Size to a supportive, snug fit.
customer_voices: I prefer the softer rubberthe VSR reads texture so well on varied rock that I'm more confident on smears.
Indoor gym climber here. The full Grip 2 sole feels great for edging, and the wide fit means no hot spots during long sessions.

description: Women's-specific soft-rubber variant of the VSR line, featuring low volume and narrower fit tuning while maintaining the full-sole Grip 2 sensitivity that defines the model. Perfect for climbers seeking a female-focused shoe with supple feel and broad terrain compatibility.
cons: Lower volume not ideal for wider feet
sizing: Women's-specific low volume and narrow fit. Minimal stretch. Size for a snug, supportive feel from day one.
customer_voices: As a woman climber, I appreciate shoes designed for my foot structure. The VSR is my go-to for anything that isn't pure overhanging bouldering.
The soft rubber is forgiving on my feet during long gym sessions, and the fit is supportive without being tight.

description: A slipper-only interpretation of the Instinct platform, the SR removes the partial midsole for direct foot-to-rock feedback while retaining the moderate downturn and wide-fit design. Soft Grip 2 rubber and minimal break-in make it an accessible gateway to performance climbing.
sizing: Standard volume, medium width; minimal stretch expected. Slipper fit accommodates quick on-off. Size to a snug, comfortable fit.
customer_voices: Intermediate bouldererthe SR is my second pair for volume climbing when I don't need the support of a midsole.
I like the slipper convenience, and the soft rubber gives me feedback I need on smears and pockets.

description: The lace-closure variant of Instinct, built for sport climbers and trad climbers who demand precise fit control. XS Edge rubber and partial midsole provide durability and support for long pitches on slab and cracks, while the medium-width last suits standard foot shapes across varied terrain.
sizing: Standard volume, medium width; minimal stretch. Lace closure allows progressive tightening. Size to a snug midfoot with secure heel.
customer_voices: Sport climber here. The lace system lets me dial in pressure exactly where I need it for full pitches.
I use these for trad climbingthe crack-edge geometry and lace fit inspire confidence on slab and vertical terrain.

description: Stripped-down slipper with no midsole, the S emphasizes raw feel and minimal weight while retaining the Instinct's wide-fit philosophy and moderate downturn. XS Edge and Grip 2 rubber combination balances edging and smearing, making it versatile for intermediate boulderers and gym rats seeking daily-driver performance.
sizing: Standard volume, medium width; minimal stretch. Slipper fit is forgiving. Size snug from day one.
customer_voices: My go-to gym shoethe S is light, responsive, and the wide fit means no cramping after hours.
Intermediate climber. The S gives me enough edge control without the weight and bulk of a midsole.

description: A leather-upper workhorse for sport climbing, the Vapor V pairs real hide with Vibram's versatile XS Edge rubber and a partial midsole designed to shine on slabs and edges. The center-shaped last suits climbers with Morton's toe or longer second toes, making it the thinking person's all-rounder.
sizing: Runs 0.5 EU size large due to leather stretch. Size down 0.5 EU from street shoe. Moderate break-in expected.
customer_voices: Sport climber and boulderer. The Vapor V is my jacket shoebreathable leather, solid all-around feel, durable enough for outdoor objectives.
I have Morton's toe and finally found a shoe that accommodates my foot shape. The Vapor V feels like it's made for me.

description: Women's version of the Vapor V, tailored with lower volume and narrower heel while maintaining the same leather durability and center-shaped last philosophy. Ideal for female climbers seeking a leather shoe that combines breathability with precise edge control across varied terrain.
sizing: Women's-specific fit with low volume and narrow heel. Leather stretches 0.5 EU; size down accordingly. Expect 2-3 sessions break-in.
customer_voices: Female sport climber. The Vapor V Women's fits my narrow foot perfectly, and the leather breathes beautifully on long routes.
The leather is soft and molds to my foot within a few sessions. Worth the premium for a shoe that lasts years.

description: The laced interpretation of the Vapor platform, offering precise fit control via lacing while retaining the versatile edge-focused design ideal for trad multi-pitch and sport climbing. Leather upper and XS Edge rubber ensure durability, while the center-shaped last accommodates diverse foot structures.
sizing: Leather stretches 0.5 EU; size down from street size. Lace allows fine-tuning. Moderate break-in expected (2-3 sessions).
customer_voices: Trad climber here. The lace system and leather durability inspire confidence on multi-pitch granite.
Sport climber. The Vapor Lace gives me the precision I need for all-day climbing and the leather has aged beautifully.

description: An affordable entry to performance climbing, the Veloce pairs moderate downturn with XS Edge rubber and a partial midsole suitable for intermediate gym climbers and casual outdoor tourists. Wide-fit last and accessible price make it an excellent beginner-to-intermediate shoe for establishing fundamentals across diverse angles.
sizing: Standard volume, medium width; minimal stretch. Size to a snug fit; expect minimal break-in.
customer_voices: Beginner climberthe Veloce is forgiving, durable, and didn't break the bank for my first real climbing shoe.
Gym regular. The Veloce works for sport and bouldering. It's not the most sensitive, but for the price, it's solid.

description: Scarpa's single-frame technology shines in the Quantix SF, a modern intermediate shoe combining asymmetry with soft Vibram XS Grip 2 rubber for sensitivity and pocket climbing. The synthetic upper requires no break-in, making it perfect for climbers who want immediate performance without leather hassles.
sizing: Synthetic upper has no stretch. Size to a snug, accurate fit from day one. Medium width, standard volume.
customer_voices: Intermediate climber moving into sport. The Quantix SF pairs soft rubber with enough asymmetry to feel special, no break-in needed.
I appreciate that the synthetic dries fast and doesn't require conditioning like leather does.

description: A lightweight introduction to technical climbing, the Arpia combines moderate downturn with Vibram XS Edge rubber and exceptional value in a men's-specific package. The rounded toe box and symmetrical design suit climbers with balanced foot geometry transitioning from beginner to intermediate.
sizing: Standard volume, medium width; minimal stretch. Size to a snug fit. Quick break-in expected.
customer_voices: Beginner to intermediate climber. The Arpia is approachable, durable, and doesn't demand a lot of foot shaping skill.
Good bang for buckthe XS Edge rubber lasts, and the balanced design works across wall angles.

description: The women's-specific Arpia, engineered with lower volume and narrower heel while maintaining the same approachable design and durable XS Edge rubber. Ideal for female climbers seeking a lightweight, forgiving intermediate shoe that doesn't sacrifice performance.
sizing: Women's-specific low volume and narrow heel. Minimal stretch. Size for a snug, supportive fit.
customer_voices: Female beginner. The Arpia Women's fits my narrow heel perfectly and has enough downturn to feel special without being overwhelming.
Intermediate female climber. These work for gym and outdoor, and at this price, I can rotate multiple pairs.

description: A flat, stiff design for trad climbing and multi-pitch routes, the Kubo prioritizes comfort and support over sensitivity. Full midsole and leather upper provide day-long stability on edges and cracks, while the Greek toe-form accommodates longer second toes common in trad climbers.
sizing: Leather stretches 0.5 EU. Size down from street size. Extended break-in (4-5 sessions) required; suits Greek/longer second toe.
customer_voices: Trad climber for 15 years. The Kubo is my cragging shoecomfort and support matter more than raw sensitivity.
The full midsole means I can wear these for entire days on granite without foot fatigue.

description: A leather lace shoe engineered for trad and sport climbing on diverse terrain, the Maestro blends stiff-moderate feel with full-midsole support and edge-focused rubber. The balanced Roman toe-form and lace closure inspire confidence on long pitches across slab, vertical, and moderate overhangs.
sizing: Leather stretches 0.5 EU; size down from street size. Lace for precise fit. Moderate 3-4 session break-in.
customer_voices: Sport climber transitioning to trad. The Maestro gives me the control I need for cracks and edges.
I love that these lace up tight at the heel and allow midfoot and toe giveperfect for full-day objectives.

description: Women's-engineered version of the Maestro, sized for lower volume and narrower fit while retaining the same leather durability, lace precision, and full-midsole support. Ideal for female trad and sport climbers seeking a durable, adjustable shoe for all-day missions.
sizing: Women's-specific low volume and narrow fit. Leather stretches 0.5 EU; size down accordingly. Moderate break-in expected.
customer_voices: Female trad climber. Finally, a Maestro engineered for my foot. The fit and support are unmatched for all-day granite.
The leather breathes, the lace system is precise, and the shoe ages beautifully over seasons.

description: The mountaineering variant of the Maestro line, featuring a stiff last, reinforced heel coverage, and technical lace closure optimized for alpine and trad climbing. Built for climbers who demand maximum support on long, demanding routes where every foot counts.
sizing: Leather stretches 0.5 EU; size down from street size. Stiff construction requires extended break-in (5-6 sessions).
customer_voices: Alpine climber. The Maestro Alpine is built for serious objectivesno nonsense, just support and durability.
The stiff platform and full rubber coverage give me confidence on loose terrain and sustained climbing.

description: A mid-height variant of the Maestro Alpine, adding ankle support without full alpine bulk. Leather upper, full midsole, and lace closure offer precision and durability for trad climbers who want protection without mountaineering weight.
sizing: Leather stretches 0.5 EU; size down from street size. Mid-height fit adds coverage. Extended 5-6 session break-in.
customer_voices: Trad climber on larger walls. The mid-height support matters on longer pushes without the alpine weight.
The lace system and leather durability make these perfect for multi-day climbing trips.

description: A laced sport shoe bridging aggression and all-day wearability, the Mago combines moderate downturn with XS Edge/Grip 2 rubber and a partial midsole. Strong asymmetry and narrow heel make it ideal for advanced climbers tackling varied terrain from slabs to pockets without midsole bulk.
sizing: Standard volume, medium width; minimal stretch. Lace allows progressive tightening. Moderate break-in expected.
customer_voices: Advanced sport climber. The Mago laces up tight, has enough downturn to feel special, and lasts full sessions.
I appreciate shoes that balance aggression and wearabilitythe Mago hits that sweet spot.

description: An elite velcro-closure weapon for overhanging terrain, the Boostic pairs strong asymmetry and aggressive downturn with a partial midsole for surprise power and endurance. Perfect for advanced climbers who want slipper convenience without sacrificing performance on roofs and pockets.
sizing: Standard volume, medium width; narrow heel. Minimal stretch. Velcro closure for quick adjustment. Size snug from day one.
customer_voices: Advanced boulderer. The Boostic is my go-to for overhanging gym and outdoorthe asymmetry and velcro are perfect.
The midsole keeps my feet fresher than pure slippers during long sessions on roofs and pockets.

description: Designed for elite sport and trad climbers, the Chimera delivers aggressively asymmetric geometry with a lace closure for precise fit control. The narrow heel and strong Egyptian toe concentration make it ideal for experienced climbers maximizing power through overhanging edges and pockets.
sizing: Standard volume with narrow heel; minimal stretch. Lace for precision. Size to snug, advanced fit.

rubber_type: Project S4 4.0mm (between XS Grip 2 and C4)
description: Premium Czech barefoot philosophy meets aggressive performance with full midsole and stiff microfiber upper. Strong asymmetry targets pockets while Project S4 rubber balances XS Grip and C4 sensitivity. Tensioned construction ensures responsive edge work across varied rock.
sizing: Microfiber minimal stretch fits true-to-size. Standard width suits typical feet; Saltic barefoot philosophy allows natural toe splay.
customer_voices: Czech barefoot philosophy with full midsole support. Best of both worlds.
Project S4 rubber performs like a secret weapon between the big names.

description: Stiff Czech Enigma variant with proprietary Extasy HG rubber and partial midsole for intermediate-to-advanced versatility. Slight asymmetry suits broader skill range while flat downturn handles slab-to-overhang. Lightweight construction enables rapid movement.
sizing: Microfiber minimal stretch fits true-to-size. Standard width accommodates typical feet; Saltic barefoot philosophy emphasizes natural geometry.
customer_voices: Stiff Enigma Black suited vertical and overhang equally. Balanced performer.
Extasy HG was a pleasant surpriseproprietary rubber works.

description: Moderate-feel Enigma variant balancing responsive feedback with extended climbing comfort. Proprietary Extasy HG rubber with partial midsole suits intermediate climbers exploring sport and trad. Minimal break-in enables rapid skill development.
sizing: Microfiber minimal stretch fits true-to-size. Standard width and volume suit beginner-to-intermediate skill levels.
customer_voices: Moderate feel meant I could climb immediately without pain.
Extasy HG proprietary rubber surprised with versatility.

description: Soft Czech aggressive specialist with no midsole and 3.5mm Extasy HG for ultimate ground feel. Moderate downturn and soft microfiber suit bouldering and sport specialists seeking maximum feedback. Minimal break-in enables quick progression.
sizing: Microfiber minimal stretch fits true-to-size. Standard width accommodates typical feet; soft nature molds over climbing sessions.
customer_voices: No midsole feels like barefoot climbing with protection. White is magic.

customer_voices: Aggressive downturn with full midsoleperfect for my pocket-climbing style.

description: Moderate-soft Czech all-terrain with moderate downturn and slight asymmetry for broad skill-range accessibility. Proprietary Extasy HG rubber with partial midsole balances responsiveness and support. Minimal break-in enables immediate climbing.

customer_voices: Moderate-soft meant I could climb all day without discomfort.
